definitions.definition: stretch out an arm in a specified direction in order to touch or grasp something.
examples: he reached over and turned off his bedside light
synonyms: stick out "Travis reached out a hand"

definitions.definition: make a movement with one's hand or arm in an attempt to touch or grasp (something).
stretch out one's hand or arm.
examples: he reached out a hand and touched her forehead

synonyms: let someone have "reach me that book"

definitions.definition: be able to touch something with an outstretched arm or leg.
examples: I had to stand on tiptoe and even then I could hardly reach

definitions.definition: arrive at; get as far as.
examples: “Goodbye,” she said as they reached the door
synonyms: come to; Moreend up at; informalmake "soon she reached Helen's house"

definitions.definition: attain or extend to (a specified point, level, or condition).
synonyms: drop to; informalhit "the temperature reached 32 degrees"

examples: the intergovernmental conference reached agreement on the draft treaty
synonyms: hammer out "the leaders reached an agreement"

definitions.definition: make contact or communicate with (someone) by telephone or other means.
examples: I've been trying to reach you all morning
synonyms: speak to; informalget hold of "I have been trying to reach you all day"

definitions.definition: (of a broadcast or other communication) be received by.
examples: television reached those parts of the electorate that other news sources could not

definitions.definition: succeed in influencing or having an effect on.
examples: their fresh sound and message reach people who may never set foot in a church
synonyms: have an impact on "our concern is to reach more people"

definitions.definition: seek to establish communication with someone, with the aim of offering or obtaining assistance or cooperation.
examples: his style was to reach out all the time, especially to members of his own party

definitions.definition: sail with the wind blowing from the side, or from slightly behind the side, of the ship.
